author: TechCrunch
title: Teen driver ejected from car during rollover crash in Hingham
text:
WFXT Teen driver ejected from car during rollover crash in Hingham Bryan Lambert December 28, 2023 at 11:15 PM ¬∑ 1 min read Link Copied Read full article
A teen driver is expected to be okay after she was ejected from her vehicle during a rollover crash in Hingham Wednesday night.
Hingham police officers responded to George Washington Boulevard in front of the Hingham District Courthouse to find a 2010 Hyundai Sonata lying on its roof with the 17-year-old girl lying in the road.
She was transported to South Shore Hospital to be treated for non-life-threatening injuries, Hingham police say.
The driver was alone in the car and no other vehicles were hit.
An initial investigation determined that the Hyundai was speeding north when it abruptly swerved over the center line into the oncoming lanes. The car then continued across the two opposite lanes and over the sidewalk where it collided into a large rock and trees.
Police say she was not wearing her seatbelt during the crash and it was clicked into the latched position behind the driver‚Äôs seat.
The driver was issued a citation for negligent operation, a marked lanes violation, speeding and a seat belt violation.
This is a developing story. Check back for updates as more information becomes available.
Download the FREE Boston 25 News app for breaking news alerts.

author: Lance Whitney
title: Firefox's new Tab Groups might be the solution to your biggest browser problem
text:
The best part? This long-awaited feature works with Firefox's popular new Vertical Tabs layout. Mozilla / Elyse Betters Picaro / ZDNET
Move over, Chrome. Watch out, Edge. Firefox has finally caught up with the competition courtesy of a helpful new skill.
Now baked into the latest version of Mozilla's browser is the long-awaited Tab Groups. Yes, that means you can organize related web pages into specific groups to keep track of them more easily and prevent the Tab bar from getting too crowded.
How to use Tab Groups in Firefox
To use Tab Groups, make sure you are running Firefox version 137 or higher. To check, click the hamburger icon at the upper right, select Help and then click About Firefox. The latest version automatically downloads and installs, prompting you to restart the browser.
Also: The Firefox I loved is gone - how to protect your privacy on it now
For now, the new feature is still in the rollout phase, which means it is not available to all Firefox users yet. Give it a few days and it should eventually pop up. OK, but how do you actually use Tab Groups?
Open two or more related web pages, maybe some stories on ZDNET. Move the tab of one page on top of the other. If the Tab Groups option is accessible, the tab you are moving takes on a dark blue border. At that point, let go of your mouse button or touchpad. A small "Create tab group" window prompts you to name the group and assign a color. After you have done both, tap Done.
You then see a tab with the name and color you assigned. Select the tab to open the group and see the web pages inside. Select it again to close the group. With the group open, simply click on each‚Ä¶
Lance Whitney
topics: Science and Technology->information technology and computer science

author: Agencias
title: Directo | Alerta roja en Andaluc√≠a por fuertes lluvias que no cesan en la Comunidad Valenciana
text:
Cinco comunidades siguen este viernes en alerta ante las fuertes precipitaciones y las tormentas que se van a registrar durante el d√≠a, y en el caso de Andaluc√≠a el nivel es rojo (riesgo extremo) ante las intensas lluvias que se van a producir en la provincia de Huelva, que en algunos casos pueden llegar a acumular hasta 140 litros por metro cuadrado.
El presidente andaluz, Juanma Moreno, pide a la poblaci√≥n que no salga de casa
El propio presidente de la Junta de Andaluc√≠a, Juanma Moreno, ha pedido "precauci√≥n" y "prudencia" a la poblaci√≥n as√≠ como evitar salir de casa "siempre que sea posible". Lo ha hecho a trav√©s de sus redes sociales.
üî¥ IMPORTANTE. Aviso rojo en El And√©valo, El Condado y el litoral de Huelva por las lluvias acumuladas durante la noche.‚Äî Juanma Moreno (@JuanMa_Moreno)
Pido EXTREMAR LA PRECAUCI√ìN. Por favor, no salgamos de casa siempre que sea posible y evitemos desplazamientos o cualquier riesgo innecesario.
PRUDENCIA.
[pic.twitter.com/o47ZTi3VzU] [November 1, 2024]
La Comunidad Valenciana, en alerta naranja
Est√° adem√°s en alerta naranja (riesgo importante) la Comunidad Valenciana, que ha padecido durante los √∫ltimos d√≠as los efectos m√°s devastadores de la DANA y donde el n√∫mero de personas fallecidas se eleva a 155, y las lluvias van a continuar a lo largo del d√≠a de hoy, seg√∫n los datos de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorolog√≠a.
‚ö†Ô∏èAVISO ROJO | Provincia de Huelva.‚Äî AEMET (@AEMET_Esp)
‚õàÔ∏èSe est√°n registrando lluvias torrenciales en localidades como Cartaya, con 117 l/m¬≤ en menos de tres horas. 70 de ellos en solo una hora. El aviso sigue activo, por ahora, hasta las 9:00
La
[#dana]va a seguir provocando hoy tiempo adverso. [pic.twitter.com/9fbyOAdTII] [November 1, 2024]
El mapa de alertas naranja se completa con avisos en grandes √°reas de Andaluc√≠a, de las comunidades de Islas Baleares y Catalu√±a, y la Aemet ha advertido de que en muchos lugares de estas comunidades las precipitaciones van a volver a superar hoy los 100 litros por metro cuadrado.
Extremadura, en alerta amarilla
El resto de alertas se completan con la comunidad de Extremadura, donde las lluvias acumular√°n 15 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora, seg√∫n la informaci√≥n de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorolog√≠a. El aviso amarillo ya est√° activado.
El Gobierno env√≠a 500 efectivos del Ej√©rcito a la provincia de Valencia
La delegada del Gobierno en la Comunidad Valenciana, Pilar Bernab√©, ha confirmado que este viernes a las 8.00 el ejecutivo central activar√° a 500 efectivos del Ej√©rcito para ayudar a la emergencia por la DANA en la provincia de Valencia, una cifra que aumentar√° a "todos los que sean necesarios".
El temporal ha dejado, seg√∫n el √∫ltimo balance provisional, 155 v√≠ctimas mortales y numerosas localidades gravemente afectadas.
Tr√°fico: carreteras cortadas en la Comunidad Valenciana, Andaluc√≠a y Castilla La Mancha
Gran n√∫mero de carreteras han sido cortadas en varias comunidades aut√≥nomas, siendo las v√≠as m√°s afectadas por las inundaciones las de la Comunidad Valenciana, seguidas de las de Andaluc√≠a y Castilla-La Mancha, por ello la Direcci√≥n General de Tr√°fico llama a los ciudadanos a reducir los desplazamientos durante este puente de Todos los Santos.
En estos momentos, Emergencias de la Generalitat aconseja evitar hacer viajes por carretera desde cualquier punto de Espa√±a hacia Valencia, y ha recordado que las v√≠as que se est√°n abriendo son de uso preferencial de los efectivos de emergencias.
Seg√∫n la DGT, varios tramos de la A-3, la A-7, la V-30 y la V-31, estas dos √∫ltimas de accesos a Valencia capital, siguen cortados por las inundaciones, al igual que otras carreteras de la red secundaria.
üì¢‚ö†Ô∏èRecomendamos consultar la informaci√≥n meteorol√≥gica antes de salir a la carretera durante las pr√≥ximas jornadas, especialmente en el festivo de Todos los Santos el viernes 1 de noviembre.‚Äî Dir. Gral. Tr√°fico (@DGTes)
[https://t.co/wl8E5ZcdVv] [October 31, 2024]
En Andaluc√≠a este viernes, los efectos de la borrasca se concentrado en la provincia de C√°diz, especialmente en los municipios de San Fernando y Chiclana por acumulaci√≥n de balsas de agua en carreteras.
En Castilla-la Mancha, la provincia de Cuenca ha sido la que m√°s ha resultado afectada por la dana, y la carretera CM-2122 sigue cerrada en el kil√≥metro 14,3, seg√∫n ha informado el Gobierno de esta Comunidad.
Tambi√©n en Tarragona contin√∫an cerradas la N-340, que est√° cortada entre Amposta y la R√†pita en sentido norte y se hacen desv√≠os por la TV-3408, y sigue cerrada la C-12 hacia Tortosa en los dos sentidos.
La DGT aconseja que cuando se produzcan causas meteorol√≥gicas extremas, se debe proceder detenerse fuera de la carretera siempre que sea posible. √ß

author: Anthony Noto
title: Trump Addresses Christian Convention: 'We Don't Answer To Washington, We Answer To God' - Benzinga
text:
Former President Donald Trump , who is expected to appear in court on March 25 for hush money payments he made to a porn star, spoke at the National Religious Broadcasters (NRB) International Christian Media Convention Thursday night in Nashville.
What Happened : According to local Nashville news outlet WKRN, Trump was introduced at the event as Jan. 6 defendants sang the national anthem.
‚ÄúWe are going to save this country. It is going to be thanks to the men and women like you, like the people in this audience,‚Äù Trump said at the beginning of his address.
‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt answer to Washington," Trump went on to say. "We answer to God.‚Äù
Trump hyped up the crowd, reminding them of his appointing conservative Supreme Court justices to help overturn Roe v. Wade . He did not, however, mention the recent Alabama Supreme Court ruling where justices ruled that frozen embryos could be considered children under state law .
‚ÄúWe have to bring back religion; we have to bring back Christianity in this country,‚Äù Trump said, promising to form a federal task force against ‚Äúanti-Christian bias.‚Äù
Trump also called President Joe Biden ‚Äúincompetent," adding that he wants to stop the ‚Äúdisaster known as ‚ÄòBidenomics'‚Äù and return to ‚ÄúMAGAnomics.‚Äù
It's worth noting that Trump‚Äôs economy grew 2.3% in 2019 (before the Covid-19 pandemic ), whereas, under Biden, the U.S. economy grew 3.1% in 2023.
‚Äú[Biden] will not lead us to the promised land,‚Äù Trump said. ‚ÄúThe greatest threat is from inside our country. We can handle Russia. We can handle all of them if we have a good leader.‚Äù
Trump, who often praises Russian President Vladimir Putin , didn't specify how he would "handle" Russia or who "all of them" are.
See Also: Republican Adam Kinzinger Warns That A 2024 Victory Spells 'The End Of American Democracy'
Why It Matters : Trump, who remains the GOP front-runner for the 2024 presidential election , continues to align his MAGA movement with evangelical voters.
This growing contingent of supporters view the former president as Jesus-like, according to The New York Times. This perspective persists despite the candidate's history of two divorces and the use of language in statements that some compare to the rhetoric found in Adolf Hitler's "Mein Kampf."
 Other Republican leaders are explicitly blurring the lines between "church and state," too. House Speaker Mike Johnson , for example, told CNBC in November that the phrase was a "misnomer."
What's Next : Trump, who has been charged in four criminal investigations , faces a key primary election in South Carolina , where his only rival for the GOP nomination is former South Carolina Governor Nikki Haley .
The two candidates then face off on Super Tuesday, March 5 .
Meanwhile, according to The New York Times, Trump supporters are reportedly trolling Haley on social media using sexual innuendo, and portraying the former UN Ambassador as Shiva, the god of destruction.
Others have directed hate against Haley's son .
Now Read: Trump Warms Up To Bitcoin After MAGA-Inspired Coin Skyrockets 20%

author: AB Newswire
title: My Dent Guy Offers Convenient In-Shop and Mobile Paintless Dent Repair Services in Naples, FL | User | mammothtimes.com
text:
My Dent Guy, a leading paintless dent repair service, continues to provide its expertise in Naples, FL. With over a decade of experience, they offer efficient and cost-effective dent repairs for all vehicle types. Providing both in-shop and mobile services, they prioritize customer convenience. Naples, FL - My Dent Guy, a leading provider of high-quality paintless dent repair services , is pleased to announce its convenient in-shop and mobile services in Naples, FL. With a commitment to exceptional customer service, My Dent Guy is revolutionizing the dent repair industry by offering efficient and cost-effective solutions for vehicles of all makes and models.
Paintless dent repair (PDR) is a specialized technique that allows for the removal of dents, dings, and hail damage without the need for traditional bodywork, sanding, or repainting. With over 11 years of experience, My Dent Guy‚Äôs PDR expertise has perfected this method, ensuring that customers receive outstanding results with minimal disruption to their daily lives.
Convenience is a top priority for My Dent Guy. Understanding that time is valuable, the company offers both in-shop and mobile services to accommodate its customers' busy schedules. Their state-of-the-art facility in Naples, FL, is equipped with cutting-edge tools and equipment, enabling their technicians to handle any dent repair job, from minor door dings to more extensive damage. Customers can drop off their vehicles at the shop, and the skilled technician at My Dent Guy will promptly restore them to their original condition.
For those unable to visit the shop, My Dent Guy's mobile service brings the expertise directly to the customer's location. Whether at home, work, or even during a shopping trip, customers can conveniently schedule an appointment, and My Dent Guy's technician will arrive fully equipped to tackle the dent repair on-site. This hassle-free service saves customers time and eliminates the need for multiple trips to the shop.
"We understand the stress and inconvenience that dents and dings can cause for vehicle owners," said Mark Tucker, of My Dent Guy. "That's why we are committed to providing our customers in Naples, FL, with exceptional paintless dent repair services that are convenient and affordable. Whether they choose to visit our shop or utilize our mobile service, we guarantee outstanding results and a seamless experience."
My Dent Guy's commitment to customer satisfaction extends beyond their repair services. They offer free estimates and competitive pricing, to make the process as smooth as possible. Mark Tucker is dedicated to delivering unparalleled workmanship and attention to detail, ensuring that every customer is thrilled with the results.
About My Dent Guy
My Dent Guy is a leading provider of paintless dent repair services in Naples, FL. My Dent Guy offers convenient in-shop and mobile services for vehicles of all makes and models. His expertise utilizes state-of-the-art techniques and tools to provide efficient and cost-effective dent repairs, saving customers time and money. For more information or to schedule an appointment, visit www.callmydentguy.com or call 239-564-3368.

author: admin_l6ma5gus
title: Junior receives another bad news, after its elimination from the Copa Libertadores: Jermein Pe√±a‚Äôs injury is serious
text:
J Unior aspired, in the year of its centenary, to go far in the Copa Libertadores. However, the elimination came early: they lost 1-2 at home against Colo Colo and that sent them to watch the rest of the tournament on television.
According to the criteria of The team led by Arturo Reyes was unable to win any match at the Roberto Mel√©ndez stadium in this edition of the tournament: they tied all three games in the group stage, against Universitario (1-1), Liga de Quito (1-1) and Botafogo (0-0).
In addition to the elimination, there is another very bad piece of news for Junior: the long-term loss of one of its starting players, defender Jermein Pe√±a.
The Samario left the field in the 22nd minute of the defeat against Colo Colo in Barranquilla and was replaced by Rafael P√©rez, who was later sent off in the 82nd for assaulting an opponent.
The diagnosis of Jermein Pe√±a‚Äôs injury Journalist Mariano Olsen revealed that Pe√±a‚Äôs injury is serious: He suffered a rupture of the anterior cruciate ligament in his left knee, which will keep him out of action for at least six months.
Pe√±a joined Junior in mid-2023 from Uni√≥n Magdalena and quickly became a key player in the team that was crowned champion of the 2023-II League.
The 24-year-old from Santa Marta has played 57 games for Junior, in all official competitions, and has not scored any goals.
Following their elimination from the Cup, Junior will face Deportes Tolima in Ibagu√© this Saturday, in the seventh round of the League. The game will start at 7:30 p.m., with a signal from Win+ F√∫tbol.

author: Brad Plumer
title: UN‚Äôs verdict on climate progress over the past year: There was none - The Boston Globe
text: Collectively, nations have been so slow to curtail their use of oil, gas, and coal that it now looks unlikely that countries will be able to limit global warming to the levels they agreed to under the 2015 Paris climate agreement. ‚ÄúAnother year passed without action means we‚Äôre worse off,‚Äù said Anne Olhoff, a climate policy expert based in Denmark and a coauthor of the assessment, known as the Emissions Gap Report. Advertisement The report comes a month before diplomats from around the world are scheduled to meet in Baku, Azerbaijan, for annual UN climate talks, where countries will discuss how they might step up efforts to address global warming. Lately, those efforts have faced huge obstacles. Even though renewable energy sources, including wind and solar, are growing rapidly around the world, demand for electricity has been rising even faster, which means countries are still burning more fossil fuels each year. Geopolitical conflicts, from the US-China rivalry to war in Ukraine and the Gaza Strip, have made international cooperation on climate change harder. And rich countries have failed to keep their financial promises to help poor countries shift away from oil, gas, and coal. At last year‚Äôs climate talks in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, representatives from nearly every nation approved a pact that called for ‚Äútransitioning away from fossil fuels‚Äù and accelerating climate action this decade. But the agreement was vague on how to do so and on which countries should do what, and so far there has been little follow-through. The new UN report finds that at least 151 countries have formally pledged under the Paris climate agreement to curb their greenhouse gas emissions by 2030. If every country followed through on its stated plans, which is far from assured, then global emissions could be 3 percent to 11 percent lower at the end of the decade than they are today. Advertisement But that would still put the Earth on track to heat up an average of roughly 2.6 to 2.8 degrees Celsius (4.7 to 5 degrees Fahrenheit) over preindustrial levels by the century‚Äôs end, the report found. The planet has already warmed roughly 1.3 degrees Celsius (2.3 degrees Fahrenheit). That may not sound like much, but every fraction of a degree of warming brings greater risks from deadly heat waves, wildfires, drought, storms and species extinction, scientists have said. Under the Paris Agreement, world leaders vowed to hold global warming to ‚Äúwell below‚Äù 2 degrees Celsius, and preferably closer to 1.5 degrees Celsius, to limit the risks from climate catastrophes. Current policies don‚Äôt come close to meeting those goals, the report found. To stay below 2 degrees Celsius, global emissions would need to fall roughly 28 percent between now and 2030. To stay at 1.5 degrees Celsius, global emissions would need to fall about 43 percent, requiring a blindingly fast transformation of the global energy system. Over the past year, only the island nation of Madagascar has submitted a new, stronger pledge to curb emissions by 2030, despite exhortations by UN officials for all countries to bolster their plans. And with each year that goes by without additional action, the cuts needed to hold warming to those low levels become more and more extreme. ‚ÄúTheoretically, it‚Äôs still possible to stay below 1.5 degrees, but it‚Äôs not really feasible anymore,‚Äù said Christoph Bertram, an associate research professor at the University of Maryland‚Äôs Center for Global Sustainability. Inger Andersen, the executive director of the UN Environment Program, said it was still important for nations to accelerate their efforts to cut emissions and keep warming as low as possible. Advertisement ‚ÄúEven if the world overshoots 1.5 degrees Celsius, and the chances of this happening are increasing every day, we must keep striving‚Äù to bring emissions down to zero as soon as possible, Andersen said. ‚ÄúEvery fraction of a degree avoided counts in terms of lives saved, economies protected, damages avoided, biodiversity conserved.‚Äù In the coming year, countries are expected to submit new formal targets for cutting emissions by 2035. It remains to be seen how ambitious those goals will be and whether countries will take concrete steps to follow through. One of the big topics at the climate talks in Baku will be money. For years, developing countries such as India and Indonesia have said they would be willing to accelerate efforts to cut emissions if they received financial assistance from wealthier countries to do so. According to the UN report, cutting global emissions to zero could require an extra $900 billion to $1.2 trillion per year in global investment. That amount, the report said, is ‚Äúsubstantial‚Äù but also manageable in the broader context of the global economy and financial markets worth close to $110 trillion. This article originally appeared in The New York Times .
